The tension in the wire is zero because sphere A is stationary.
The electrostatic force between sphere A and sphere B is balanced by the component of gravity along the inclined plane.
The component of gravity along the inclined plane is $mg \sin 	heta$.
The electrostatic force between the two spheres is $k  rac{q^2}{d^2}$.
Setting the electrostatic force equal to the component of gravity gives $k  rac{q^2}{d^2} = mg \sin 	heta$
Solving for $ rac{q}{d}$ gives $ rac{q}{d} = \sqrt{ rac{mg \sin 	heta}{k}}$.
